description: I've addressed all the outstanding issues and tested this code. The new update allows the user to define a filter if desired and returns the z_from_t functionality.
title: sfr_spectrum.py update for yt-3.0

content.raw: All tests pass. Good job!
content.html: All tests pass. Good job!

content.raw: Moved to 3.0
content.html: Moved to 3.0

content.raw: All tests pass. Good job!
content.html: All tests pass. Good job!

content.raw: @brittonsmith can you take a quick pass?
content.html: Britton Smith can you take a quick pass?

content.raw: I see some changes that need to be made to the default particle filtering, which I'll comment below in the code.
content.html: I see some changes that need to be made to the default particle filtering, which I'll comment below in the code.

content.raw: Default should be None, meaning that the old filter of ct > 0 should be used.
content.html: Default should be None, meaning that the old filter of ct > 0 should be used.

content.raw: If the filter is None, then it should be left alone.
content.html: If the filter is None, then it should be left alone.

content.raw: I think that if the filter is None, then the "stars" particle should be used.  If it's user-defined, then the data should be pulled from self._data_source[filter, "particle_mass"].
content.html: I think that if the filter is None, then the "stars" particle should be used. If it's user-defined, then the data should be pulled from self._data_source[filter, "particle_mass"].

content.raw: ``filter`` is a reserved word in Python.  Can you name this something else?
content.html: filter is a reserved word in Python. Can you name this something else?

content.raw: This should work, but updated to have units of "Mpccm**3".  However, the volume function still uses "CellVolume" in enzo.  I haven't checked in other frontends.
content.html: This should work, but updated to have units of "Mpccm**3". However, the volume function still uses "CellVolume" in enzo. I haven't checked in other frontends.

content.raw: See my comments above about the default and user-defined filters.
content.html: See my comments above about the default and user-defined filters.

content.raw: See my comments above about the default and user-defined filters.
content.html: See my comments above about the default and user-defined filters.

content.raw: Agreed.  Something like particle_filter would work.
content.html: Agreed. Something like particle_filter would work.

content.raw:
Perhaps it is worthwhile to update the recipe in the cookbook that does SFR plotting to incorporate this new functionality instead of relying on homegrown code?

http://yt-project.org/docs/dev/cookbook/calculating_information.html#using-particle-filters-to-calculate-star-formation-rates
content.html:
Perhaps it is worthwhile to update the recipe in the cookbook that does SFR plotting to incorporate this new functionality instead of relying on homegrown code?

http://yt-project.org/docs/dev/cookbook/calculating_information.html#using-particle-filters-to-calculate-star-formation-rates

content.raw: -1 on removing that recipe entirely.  Maybe just add a new one?
content.html: -1 on removing that recipe entirely. Maybe just add a new one?

content.raw: That sounds like a bug - mind filing an issue?
content.html: That sounds like a bug - mind filing an issue?

content.raw: Done.
content.html: Done.

content.raw: Hi, this seems like a pretty important PR.  Is there a status update we might get on it?
content.html: Hi, this seems like a pretty important PR. Is there a status update we might get on it?

content.raw: I'll work on this and send it out ASAP.
content.html: I'll work on this and send it out ASAP.

content.raw: Oh. I'll work on it this week and send it out by the end.
content.html: Oh. I'll work on it this week and send it out by the end.

content.raw: These changes should probably be grafted to the `yt` branch.
content.html: These changes should probably be grafted to the yt branch.

content.raw: I can do that post-review.
content.html: I can do that post-review.

content.raw: Any reason we can't bring in and graft these?
content.html: Any reason we can't bring in and graft these?

content.raw:
Nope, it's pretty self-contained and is a clear improvement.

Want to handle manually merging this in?
content.html:
Nope, it's pretty self-contained and is a clear improvement.

Want to handle manually merging this in?

content.raw: Yup, I'll take care of it.
content.html: Yup, I'll take care of it.

content.raw: Hi @kbarrow , this PR is listed as *declined*, but that's not the case -- I've pulled in the changesets, and they're now visible as c6844e1eb1bf through bff388fc3306.  Thank you very much for your work on this, and congrats on your first patch to yt!
content.html: Hi Kirk Barrow , this PR is listed as declined, but that's not the case -- I've pulled in the changesets, and they're now visible as c6844e1eb1bf through bff388fc3306. Thank you very much for your work on this, and congrats on your first patch to yt!
